_header: Wretched man why art thou proud
Note: Incorporated in certain MSS of ‘Erthe upon Erthe’ (1170 and 6369); cf. 6229.
_description: A reminder of Mortality, a tag in the Fasciculus Morum — 8 lines (abababab)

BodLauMis111.Transcription:
Wrecche mon wy artou proudþat art of herth I makethydyr ne
                    browteston no schroudbut pore þou come & nakedWen þi
                    soule is faren out þi body with erthe y raked þat body
                    þat was so ronk and loud of alle men is i hated
BodLauMis111.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 237.
Oliver,  Raymond. 
             Poems Without Names: The English Lyric 1200-1500.
         Berkeley, CA: University of California, 1970: 76.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 228.

BodLauMis213.First Lines:
Wreche mon why artou proud þat art of herþe I
                    makydHedyr ne browtes tou no schroudebot pore þu come &
                    naked…
BodLauMis213.Last Lines:
…þat body þat was so ronke & loudof all men is I
                    hated

BodRawC670.First Lines:
Wreche mon why art þou prowdeÞat art of erthe
                    maket…
BodRawC670.Last Lines:
…Þat body þa[t] was so ronke and loudeOf alle men is
                    hated

Silverstein,  Theodore,

Wenzel,  Siegfried.

CamGon364.First Lines:
Wreche man qwy art þou prowdþat of erthe is
                    maked…
CamGon364.Last Lines:
…þe body þat was so rond & loudof alle schal be
                    hated

EDU82.First Lines:
Wreche man why artt thou prowdeþat art of erthe I
                    maketHyder in browtest þu noo shrodebut pore þu come &
                    naked…
EDU82.Last Lines:
…That body that was so ranke and loudeof all men is
                    hated

Lincoln44.First Lines:
Wreche man whi art þow prowdeþat art of erþe
                    makedehyder broght þow no strowdebote pouer and
                    naket…
Lincoln44.Last Lines:
…þat was so stowte & prowteof al manne ys I
                    hatede

WorcF19.First Lines:
Wreche man wy art þu proudþat art of erþe
                    maked…
WorcF19.Last Lines:
…þy bodi þat was so rank & loueof alle men he ys
                    hatyd
